page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: At the time of the first Domesday Book,Malvern Link was in the Manor of Leigh and owned by the Abbey of Pershore. The Link "Walk" was part of Malvern Chase and had its own keeper. The oldest monument in Malvern Link is the "Whore" Stone or old stone. It was already old in 1584 when situated at Link Top, junction of Newtown Road, but in 1744 it was at the junction of Pickersleigh Road and Worcester Road.In shape it is a cube with a groove on the top. This is probably for coins. It probably received payments for the right to cross from Powick into Leigh. It now rests inside the Hampden Road entrance to S. Matthias' churchyard.
